Description: Circular green steatite votive patera; inside are three relief busts(very worn) of Serapis, Isis and Harpocrates; volutes(chipped) project from the rim; rosette surrounded by foliate patterns on the underside.
Curator's comments: For corpus, cf. Louvre MA 2734; Ashmolean 1891.432 (Chester Qena), 1891.501 (Chester), 1891.546 (Chester), 1932.661, 1941.1250, 1941.1251 (both acq. Luxor 1907); BM EA 32255 (Chester), 36135 (Chester), 38511 (Chester), 38512 (Hay), 38513 (Cureton), 38514 (Chester), 38515 (Chester), 38516 (unknown), 38517 (Chester), 64024, 69181-82 (both transferred from V&A, acq. 'Wallis?').
Acquisition name: Transferred from: Victoria and Albert Museum
